document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the genus Sirthenea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) of the Old World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the genus Sirthenea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) of the Old World

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Rasahus flaviceps
Signoret, 1860 : 960
. Syntype (s): Madagascar ; NHMW.

Sirthenea flaviceps var. adelpha
Horváth, 1909 : 361
. Syntypes ( ♂ , ♀ ): Madagascar : Antongil Bay; HNHM.

Sirthenea flaviceps var. lugubris
Horváth, 1909 :361
. Syntype (s) ( ♀ ): Madagascar : Bezanozano; MNHN.

[printed] ( MMBC ). 2 ƋƋ: Madagascar 2011 / Ambohitantely Spec. Res. / S18°11'51" E17°17'03" / 1530m ; at light, 24–29.xi. / P. Baňař lgt. [printed] ( MMBC ).

Diagnosis. Recognized among other congeners by the large body size, yellowish legs, club-shaped scape not surpassing apex of head as well as anterior pronotal lobe with distinct sulci, short and wide apodeme depression, and lack of collar. It can easily be separated from the only other congener occurring in Madagascar ,
S . ( Monogmus ) picescens
, primarily by the short median process of the pygophore, the different structure of its aedeagus, and its slender parameres.

MAP 2. Distribution of
Sirthenea flaviceps ( Signoret, 1860 )
.

Measurements (in mm, male in parentheses): Body length: 22.9–24.8 (20.3–21.2); maximum width of abdomen: 4.3–5.5 (4.0–4.5); head length: 3.5–4.5 (3.5–3.8); head width: 2.4–2.6 (2.3–2.4); length of anteocular part: 2.0–2.6 (1.8–2.2); length of postocular part: 0.6–0.7 (0.4–0.5); length of synthlipsis: 1.2–1.5 (1.0); interocellar distance: 0.65–0.9 (0.6–0.7); length of antennal segments I:II:III:IV: 1.1–1.3 (0.9–1.0): 2.0–2.1 (2.0–2.3): 1.6–1.7 (1.8–2.0): 1.5–1.6 (1.7–2.0); length of visible labial segments I:II:III: 1.3–1.5 (1.1–1.3): 2.8–3.8 (2.8–3.6): 1.6–2.0 (1.2–1.6); maximum length of anterior pronotal lobe: 3.3–3.7 (2.7–3.3); maximum length of posterior pronotal lobe: 1.8–2.0 (1.7–2.2); maximum width of anterior pronotal lobe: 3.8–4.4 (3.6–3.8); maximum width of posterior pronotal lobe: 4.6–5.2 (4.4–4.8); length of scutellum: 1.5–1.8 (1.3–1.6); length of hemelytron: 13.3–15.0 (12.9– 14.0).

Comments : Two color forms of
S. flaviceps
were described by Horváth (1909) .
S. flaviceps var. adelpha
( Fig. 194 ) differs from the typical form ( Fig. 15 ) by the dark apical part of hemelytron and medial part of clavus, with basal part (including margins) and medial part of clavus dark (pale area is variable in shape and size in different specimens).
S. flaviceps var. lugubris
( Fig. 195 ) can be easily recognized by the head, pronotum and hemelytron being dark brown to black; paler antennifer and pale clypeus, area on anteocular part of head (in some cases reaching to transversal suture of the head). These colour varieties are conspecific with
S. flaviceps
and have no taxonomic or nomenclatural value.
